etymology.description: Pictogram: four dots (like grains of sand) indicating “a few, a little”; phonetically borrowed from 小 (“small,” depicted by three dots). Unrelated to 步.
etymology.interpretation: Originally depicted a small cluster of dots, evoking a tiny quantity such as grains of sand, hence the sense “few; little.” Its form and sound link to 小, which also shows small marks and means “small,” but it is not connected to 步/歲 despite visual resemblance.

examples.chinese: 我们的时间很少(我們的時間很少)。
今天来的人很少(今天來的人很少)。
examples.pinyin: Jīntiān lái de rén hěn shǎo.

examples.chinese: 他话不多(他話不多)，笑得也少(笑得也少)。
examples.pinyin: Tā huà bù duō, xiào de yě shǎo.
examples.english: He doesn't talk much, and he also smiles little.
